page.title: 03CROSS FARM
page.content: The present owner of Cross Farm has lived there since 1954.He farms 92 acres of land some of which is tenanted. The land is used for growing carrots,potatoes,sugarbeet,barley and wheat.The farm as well as having all these crops is a pig farm.There are 3O sows and 3 boars.The 3O sows produce on average 5OO to 6OO piglets a year which are sold for fattening up.The average sized litter of piglets that a sow has is 7 to 15 but litters of over 15 or 2O are not unknown.When a sow is 6 years old it is sent off to be slaughtered. The breeds of pig that are reared on Cross Farm are Large White and Landrace. A varied selection of machinery enables the owner to work the farm with a minimum of extra help.
